snippet: A measure that would outlaw workplace discrimination against gay men, lesbians and transgender people overcame a significant obstacle in the Senate as seven Republicans voted to begin debate on the bill.
abstract: Seven Republicans cross party lines to advance debate in Senate on a measure that would outlaw workplace discrimination based on sexual orientation and gender identity.
lead_paragraph: A measure that would outlaw workplace discrimination against gay men, lesbians and transgender people overcame a significant obstacle in the Senate as seven Republicans voted to begin debate on the bill.

headline.main: Bill Advances to Outlaw Discrimination Against Gays
headline.print_headline: Bill Advances To Outlaw Discrimination Against Gays
